meanings.definition: Existing in a person or thing from birth; innate.
meanings.sent1: Her connatural kindness shone through in every action she took.
meanings.sent2: The siblings had connatural talents for music, both playing the piano effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: It was connatural for the puppy to wag its tail happily when it saw its owner.
meanings.sent4: The connatural beauty of the sunset painted the sky in hues of pink and orange.
meanings.sent5: The connatural bond between the twins was evident in their synchronized movements.

meanings.definition: Having the same nature or characteristics; similar in nature.
meanings.sent1: Their connatural love for adventure led them to explore new places together.
meanings.sent2: The two friends had connatural tastes in movies, always enjoying the same genres.
meanings.sent3: It seemed connatural for the two old friends to finish each other's sentences.
meanings.sent4: The connatural rhythm of the dancers created a mesmerizing performance on stage.
meanings.sent5: The connatural patterns in the artwork reflected the artist's unique style.

meanings.sent1: His connatural ability to make people laugh made him the life of the party.
meanings.sent2: The athlete's connatural agility on the field impressed both teammates and opponents.
meanings.sent3: It was connatural for the baby to reach out for her mother's comforting embrace.
meanings.sent4: The connatural grace of the swan gliding on the lake captivated onlookers.
meanings.sent5: The connatural instincts of the wild animals guided them through the changing seasons.
